content:
MultiShardCommand.ExecuteReaderAsync Method

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Query
Assembly:
Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Client.dll

In this Article

Overloads

ExecuteReaderAsync()

The ExecuteReader methods of the MultiShardCommand execute the given command statement on each shard and return the concatenation (i.e. UNION ALL) of the individual results from the shards in a MultiShardDataReader. The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.
ExecuteReaderAsync(CancellationToken)

The ExecuteReader methods of the MultiShardCommand execute the given command statement on each shard and return the concatenation (i.e. UNION ALL) of the individual results from the shards in a MultiShardDataReader. The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.
ExecuteReaderAsync(CommandBehavior, CancellationToken)

The ExecuteReader methods of the MultiShardCommand execute the given command statement on each shard and return the concatenation (i.e. UNION ALL) of the individual results from the shards in a MultiShardDataReader. The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.

ExecuteReaderAsync()

The ExecuteReader methods of the MultiShardCommand execute the given command statement on each shard and return the concatenation (i.e. UNION ALL) of the individual results from the shards in a MultiShardDataReader. The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.

public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Azure.SqlDatabase.ElasticScale.Query.MultiShardDataReader> ExecuteReaderAsync ();
Returns
Task<MultiShardDataReader>

a task warapping the MultiShardDataReader instance with the overall concatenated result set.

Exceptions
System.InvalidOperationException

thrown if the commandText is null or empty, or if the specified command behavior is not supported such as CloseConnection or SingleRow.

System.TimeoutException

thrown if the CommandTimeout elapsed prior to completion.

Remarks

Any exceptions during command execution are conveyed via the returned Task.

The execution policy regarding result completeness can be controlled by setting the MultiShardExecutionPolicy. The default execution policy is to return complete results.
